name: google_analytics
description: Google Analytics tracks and reports website traffic, user behavior, and conversion data, enabling marketers to optimize online performance and customer journeys

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_BATCH_RUN_REPORTS
tools.description: Tool to return multiple analytics data reports in a batch. Use when you need to fetch multiple reports for one GA4 property in a single request.

inputSchema.title: BatchRunReportsRequest

property.title: Property
property.description: Required. The property resource name. Format: properties/{property_id}

requests.title: Requests
requests.description: Required. Up to 5 individual RunReportRequest objects.

inputSchema.description: Request model for executing multiple report requests in a batch.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_CHECK_COMPATIBILITY
tools.description: Tool to list dimensions and metrics compatible with a GA4 report request. Use when you need to validate compatibility of chosen dimensions or metrics before running a report.

inputSchema.title: CheckCompatibilityRequest

items.title: Metric

name.title: Name
name.description: The API name of the metric, e.g., 'activeUsers'.

items.description: Model for a metric in a compatibility check request.

metrics.title: Metrics
metrics.description: Optional. List of metrics to check compatibility for.

property.title: Property
property.description: Required. GA4 property resource name. Format: properties/{property_id}.

items.title: Dimension

name.title: Name
name.description: The API name of the dimension, e.g., 'country'.

items.description: Model for a dimension in a compatibility check request.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: Optional. List of dimensions to check compatibility for.

metricFilter.title: Metric Filter
metricFilter.description: Optional. A FilterExpression for metrics; must follow GA4 FilterExpression JSON schema.

dimensionFilter.title: Dimension Filter
dimensionFilter.description: Optional. A FilterExpression for dimensions; must follow GA4 FilterExpression JSON schema.

compatibilityFilter.title: CompatibilityEnum
compatibilityFilter.description: Compatibility status for dimensions or metrics.

inputSchema.description: Request model for the checkCompatibility method.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_CREATE_AUDIENCE_EXPORT
tools.description: Tool to create an audience export. Use after configuring the audience and dimensions to produce a long-running Operation.

inputSchema.title: CreateAudienceExportRequest

audience.title: Audience
audience.description: Audience resource name to export. Format: properties/{property_id}/audiences/{audience_id}.

items.title: AudienceDimension

dimensionName.title: Dimension Name
dimensionName.description: API name of the dimension to include.

items.description: Dimension to include in the audience export.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: List of dimensions to include in the export.

inputSchema.description: Request model for creating an AudienceExport.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_CREATE_AUDIENCE_LIST
tools.description: Tool to create an audience list. Use when you need to define and asynchronously populate a new AudienceList resource under a GA4 property.

inputSchema.title: CreateAudienceListRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Parent property resource name. Format: properties/{property_id}.

dimensionName.title: Dimension Name
dimensionName.description: API name of the supported audience-export dimension.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: List of dimensions to include in the audience list output.

webhookNotification.title: WebhookNotification

uri.title: Uri
uri.description: HTTPS endpoint URL to receive POST notifications.

channelToken.title: Channel Token
channelToken.description: Optional token echoed in X-Goog-Channel-Token header.

webhookNotification.description: Configuration for receiving webhook notifications about operation status.

inputSchema.description: Request model for creating an AudienceList under a GA4 property.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_CREATE_EXPANDED_DATA_SET
tools.description: Tool to create an expanded data set for a property. Use when you need to combine specific dimensions and metrics into a custom dataset after property creation.

inputSchema.title: CreateExpandedDataSetRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Parent property resource name. Format: properties/{propertyId}

expandedDataSet.title: Expanded Data Set

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional. Description of the expanded data set.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: Required. Human-readable display name for the expanded data set.

metricNames.title: Metric Names
metricNames.description: Required. List of metric names to include in the expanded data set.

dimensionNames.title: Dimension Names
dimensionNames.description: Required. List of dimension names to include in the expanded data set.

expandedDataSet.description: Definition of the ExpandedDataSet to create.

inputSchema.description: Request model for creating an ExpandedDataSet.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_CREATE_ROLLUP_PROPERTY
tools.description: Tool to create a GA4 Roll-up Property and optionally initial source links.

inputSchema.title: CreateRollupPropertyRequest

account.title: Account
account.description: Required. Parent account resource. Format: accounts/{account_id}

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: Required. IANA time zone for the roll-up property.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: Required. Display name for the roll-up property.

sourceProperties.title: Source Properties
sourceProperties.description: Optional. List of source property resource names to link. Format: properties/{property_id}.

inputSchema.description: Request model for creating a GA4 Roll-up Property using properties.createRollupProperty.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_GET_ACCOUNT
tools.description: Tool to retrieve a single Account by its resource name. Use when you need detailed account info after confirming the account resource name (e.g., accounts/100).

inputSchema.title: GetAccountRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Required. The resource name of the Account to retrieve. Format: accounts/{account_id}, e.g., 'accounts/100'.

inputSchema.description: Request model for retrieving a single Account.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_GET_AUDIENCE_EXPORT
tools.description: Tool to get configuration metadata for an Audience Export. Use after creating an Audience Export to retrieve its status and details.

inputSchema.title: GetAudienceExportRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Required. The resource name of the Audience Export to retrieve. Format: properties/{property}/audienceExports/{audienceExport}.

inputSchema.description: Request model for retrieving a specific Audience Export.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_GET_AUDIENCE_LIST
tools.description: Tool to get configuration metadata about a specific audience list. Use after confirming the audience list resource name.

inputSchema.title: GetAudienceListRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Required. The resource name of the Audience List to retrieve. Format: properties/{property}/audienceLists/{audienceList}.

inputSchema.description: Request model for retrieving a specific Audience List.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_GET_KEY_EVENT
tools.description: Tool to retrieve a Key Event. Use after confirming the key event resource name.

inputSchema.title: GetKeyEventRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Required. Resource name of the Key Event to retrieve. Format: properties/{property}/keyEvents/{keyEvent}.

inputSchema.description: Request model for retrieving a Key Event in a Google Analytics 4 property.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_GET_METADATA
tools.description: Tool to get metadata for dimensions, metrics, and comparisons for a GA4 property. Use when you need to discover available fields before building a report.

inputSchema.title: GetMetadataRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Resource name of the metadata to retrieve. Format: properties/{property_id}/metadata. Use property_id=0 to return only universal (non-custom) metadata.

inputSchema.description: Request model for retrieving metadata of dimensions, metrics, and comparisons for a GA4 property.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_GET_PROPERTY_QUOTAS_SNAPSHOT
tools.description: Tool to retrieve all property quotas organized by category for a given property. Use when you need to check current quota usage for a GA4 property.

inputSchema.title: GetPropertyQuotasSnapshotRequest

property.title: Property
property.description: Required. The property resource. Format: properties/{property_id}.

inputSchema.description: Request model for retrieving a property quotas snapshot.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_LIST_ACCOUNTS
tools.description: Tool to list all Accounts accessible by the caller. Use when you need to enumerate all Google Analytics accounts your credentials can access.

inputSchema.title: ListAccountsRequest

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of accounts to return. Must be ≥1.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results.

showDeleted.title: Show Deleted
showDeleted.description: Optional. Whether to include soft-deleted (trashed) Accounts.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing Accounts.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_LIST_AUDIENCE_EXPORTS
tools.description: Tool to list all audience exports for a GA4 property. Use when you need to fetch its export history after initiating exports.

inputSchema.title: ListAudienceExportsRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Required. Resource name of the parent property. Format: properties/{property_id}

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of results to return. Defaults to 200; larger values are coerced to 1000.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results; other parameters must match original call when paginating.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing AudienceExports under a GA4 property.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_LIST_AUDIENCE_LISTS
tools.description: Tool to list all audience lists for a GA4 property. Use when you need to retrieve a property's configured audience lists after confirming the property ID.

inputSchema.title: ListAudienceListsRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Required. Resource name of the parent property. Format: properties/{property_id}

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of audience lists to return. Defaults to 200; maximum is 1000.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing AudienceLists under a GA4 property.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_LIST_AUDIENCES
tools.description: Tool to list all audiences on a property. Use when you need to fetch all audiences for a GA4 property after confirming its existence.

inputSchema.title: ListAudiencesRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Required. Property ID or full resource name. Accepts: '123456789' or 'properties/123456789'

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of Audiences to return.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing Audiences under a property.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_LIST_KEY_EVENTS
tools.description: Tool to list Key Events. Use when you need to retrieve all key event definitions for a given property.

inputSchema.title: ListKeyEventsRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Required. Resource name of the parent property. Format: properties/{property_id}.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of results to return. Must be between 1 and 200.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing Key Events under a specified parent property.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_LIST_PROPERTIES
tools.description: Tool to list GA4 properties under a specific account. Use after obtaining an account ID; supports pagination and including soft-deleted properties.

inputSchema.title: ListPropertiesRequest

account.title: Account
account.description: Required. The account resource name. Format: accounts/{account_id}

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of properties to return; must be between 1 and 200.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token returned from a previous call to retrieve the next page of results.

showDeleted.title: Show Deleted
showDeleted.description: Optional. Whether to include soft-deleted (trashed) properties.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing GA4 properties under an account.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_LIST_REPORTING_DATA_ANNOTATIONS
tools.description: Tool to list all Reporting Data Annotations on a property. Use when you need to retrieve or inspect annotations for a GA4 property.

inputSchema.title: ListReportingDataAnnotationsRequest

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Restricts which annotations are listed. Supported fields: name, title, description, annotationDate, annotationDateRange, color; operations: =, !=, <, >, <=, >=, :, =~, !~, NOT, AND, OR; helper functions: annotation_duration(), is_annotation_in_range(startDate,endDate).

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Resource name of the property. Format: properties/{property_id}.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of annotations to return. Defaults to 50, max 200.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing Reporting Data Annotations on a property.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_LIST_ROLLUP_PROPERTIES
tools.description: Tool to list roll-up GA4 properties accessible to the caller. Use when you need to identify roll-up properties across all accessible accounts.

inputSchema.title: ListRollupPropertiesRequest

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of account summaries to return; must be between 1 and 200.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing roll-up GA4 properties accessible to the caller.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_LIST_SEARCH_ADS360_LINKS
tools.description: Tool to list all SearchAds360Links on a property. Use when you need to fetch all Search Ads 360 links for a given property after authenticating.

inputSchema.title: ListSearchAds360LinksRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Required. Resource name of the property. Format: properties/{propertyId} (e.g., properties/1234).

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of results to return. Must be between 1 and 200. Defaults to 50.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing SearchAds360Links for a Google Analytics property.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_QUERY_AUDIENCE_EXPORT
tools.description: Tool to query a completed audience export. Use when you need to fetch user rows with pagination.

inputSchema.title: QueryAudienceExportRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Required. Resource name of the audience export. Format: properties/{property}/audienceExports/{audienceExport}.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Optional. Number of rows to return. Must be between 1 and 250000. Defaults to 10000.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Optional. Zero-based start row index for pagination. Defaults to 0.

inputSchema.description: Request model for querying an existing Google Analytics audience export.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_QUERY_AUDIENCE_LIST
tools.description: Tool to query an audience list. Use when you need to retrieve user rows from a GA4 audience list with pagination.

inputSchema.title: QueryAudienceListRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Required. Audience list resource to query. Format: properties/{property}/audienceLists/{audienceList}.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Optional. Number of rows to return; default 10,000; maximum 250,000.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Optional. Zero-based row offset for pagination.

inputSchema.description: Request model for querying a Google Analytics audience list.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_RUN_FUNNEL_REPORT
tools.description: Tool to run a GA4 funnel report. Use when you need a customized funnel analysis report for a given property.

inputSchema.title: RunFunnelReportRequest

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Number of rows to return. Default 10000; max 250000.

funnel.title: Funnel
funnel.description: Funnel configuration object following the API schema (must include 'steps').

property.title: Property
property.description: GA4 property resource name, format: properties/{property_id}.

segments.title: Segments
segments.description: Up to 4 segments; each yields its own row in the report.

name.title: Name
name.description: Optional user-defined name for this date range.

endDate.title: End Date
endDate.description: End date of the report range. Format YYYY-MM-DD or relative (e.g., 'today', '1daysAgo').

startDate.title: Start Date
startDate.description: Start date of the report range. Format YYYY-MM-DD or relative (e.g., '7daysAgo', 'today').

dateRanges.title: Date Ranges
dateRanges.description: List of date ranges to read; overlapping ranges duplicate days across ranges.

funnelBreakdown.title: Funnel Breakdown
funnelBreakdown.description: Breakdown dimension configuration for the funnel table sub-report.

funnelNextAction.title: Funnel Next Action
funnelNextAction.description: Next-action dimension configuration for the funnel visualization sub-report.

returnPropertyQuota.title: Return Property Quota
returnPropertyQuota.description: If true, includes the property's current quota state.

inputSchema.description: Request model for running a GA4 funnel report.

tools.name: GOOGLE_ANALYTICS_RUN_REPORT
tools.description: Tool to run a customized GA4 data report. Use when you need event data after specifying dimensions, metrics, and date ranges.

inputSchema.title: RunReportRequest

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Optional. Number of rows to return. Must be between 1 and 250000.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Optional. 0-based start row for pagination. Must be >= 0.

metrics.title: Metrics
metrics.description: Optional. The metrics to request and display. Each metric is an object with a 'name' field.

orderBys.title: Order Bys
orderBys.description: Optional. Specify how rows are ordered. Each object defines dimension or metric ordering.

property.title: Property
property.description: Required. The property resource on which to run the report. Format: properties/{property_id}.

cohortSpec.title: Cohort Spec
cohortSpec.description: Optional. Cohort specification. Requires requesting the cohort dimension.

dateRanges.title: Date Ranges
dateRanges.description: Optional. The date ranges to read. Each range requires 'startDate' and 'endDate'.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: Optional. The dimensions to request and display. Each dimension is an object with a 'name' field.

comparisons.title: Comparisons
comparisons.description: Optional. The comparison configuration. Adds a comparison column to the response.

currencyCode.title: Currency Code
currencyCode.description: Optional. The currency code to apply, in ISO 4217 format. Defaults to property currency.

metricFilter.title: Metric Filter
metricFilter.description: Optional. The filter expression to restrict metric values. Applied after aggregation.

keepEmptyRows.title: Keep Empty Rows
keepEmptyRows.description: Optional. If true, rows with all zero metrics will be returned; otherwise omitted.

dimensionFilter.title: Dimension Filter
dimensionFilter.description: Optional. The filter expression to restrict dimension values. Only dimensions are allowed.

metricAggregations.title: Metric Aggregations
metricAggregations.description: Optional. Aggregation types to include over metrics, e.g., 'TOTAL', 'MINIMUM', 'MAXIMUM'.

returnPropertyQuota.title: Return Property Quota
returnPropertyQuota.description: Optional. If true, include the property's current quota state in the response.

inputSchema.description: Request model for running a customized Google Analytics 4 report.
